actions.committee: House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service.

committees.committee: House Post Office and Civil Service

official_title: A bill to amend the Legislative Reorganization Act of 1946 to provide that any increase in the pay of Members of the Congress may not take effect until the first day of the Congress following the Congress during which such increase is adopted.

summary.text: Stipulates, under the provisions of the Legislative Reorganization Act, that any increase in the pay of Members of the Congress may not take effect until the first day of the Congress following the Congress during which such increase is adopted. Makes the provisions of this Act applicable to increases passed after June 30, 1975, and to alternative plans and recommendations regarding pay transmitted by the President after such date.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Legislative Reorganization Act of 1946 to provide that any increase in the pay of Members of the Congress may not take effect until the first day of the Congress following the Congress during which such increase is adopted.
